{{Infobox person | name = Yoram Harth | image = YoramNew.jpg | alt = Yoram Harth MD | caption = Yoram Harth MD | birth_name = יורם הרט | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|08|27}} | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = [[dermatologist]], [[inventor]] | net worth = | occupation = }} '''Yoram Harth''' ([[Hebrew]]: '''יורם הרט'''; born 27 August 1958) is an [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[dermatologist]] and [[inventor]]. He co-invented blue light [[Acne|acne vulgaris]] [[phototherapy]],<ref name="Singapore Medical">"Skin Problems? Just A Light Zap Away!", ''[http://medicalgrapevineasia Singapore Medical Grapevine]{{dead link|date=July 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} – A Medical Practice Magazine'' 2004/2005 special Issue , pp. 1, 20-21.</ref><ref name="Amy Tiebel">Tiebel, Amy (22 November 2002).[https://online.wsj.com/public/resources/documents/0,,SB1037814583993174068,00.html?mod=technologyinnovation_1 "Special Report: Technology Innovation - Israeli Therapy Shines Light on Cure for Acne"]. ''[[Wall Street Journal]]''.</ref> <ref name="Williams Samten">Samten, Williams (June 2000). [http://connection.ebscohost.com/c/articles/3455610/phototherapy-device-acne-uses-visible-light "Phototherapy Device for Acne Uses Visible Light."] ''Dermatology Times''. Vol. 21 Issue 6, p14.</ref> as well as a [[radio frequency]] device for home treatment for [[wrinkle]] reduction.
Harth was the founder, [[President (corporate title)|President]], and [[Medical Director]] of CureLight Medical Ltd. <ref name="Shmoul Avi"> Shmoul Avi (11 July 2002) [http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/israeli-scientists-market-safe-sun-rays-to-treat-acne-1.39978 Israeli Scientists Market Safe Sun-rays to Treat Acne] in [[Haaretz]] </ref> <ref name="Singapore Medical"/> <ref name="Bloomberg">[https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=941398&ticker=ENDY:IT Profile in Bloomberg] </ref> He was the Chief Medical Officer and the founder of Endymed Medical Ltd.<ref name="Endymed"/><ref name="Bloomberg"/> and he is now the co-founder and medical director of MDacne. <ref name="San Francisco Chronicle"> Thadani, Trisha (January 22, 2018). [http://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Got-acne-This-startup-says-its-selfie-app-can-12512723.php Got acne? This startup says its selfie app can help]. [[San Francisco Chronicle]]. </ref> <ref name="Shacklett"> Shacklett, Mary (December 6, 2016). [http://www.techrepublic.com/article/how-an-analytics-app-is-changing-the-lives-of-acne-patients/ How an analytics app is changing the lives of acne patients]. [[TechRepublic]]. </ref>
==Biography== Yoram Harth's father was a [[physician]] who specialised in [[internal medicine]].<ref name="Singapore Medical"/> Harth is a [[Magna cum Laude]] graduate of the [[Sackler Faculty of Medicine|Sackler School of Medicine]] in [[Tel Aviv University]] (1982).<ref>{{cite web|title=AAD Members Directory|url=https://www.aad.org/find-a-derm/N725E/Yoram-Harth-MD|website=American Academy of Dermatology}}</ref> Harth received his Dermatology training in the department of Dermatology at [[Rambam Health Care Campus|Rambam Medical School]] in [[Haifa]] <ref name="Shmoul Avi"/> and served as a research fellow in the department of Dermatology at the [[Presbyterian Hospital (New York City)|Columbia – Presbyterian Medical center]] in [[New York City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Cancer Research Study|url=http://cancerres.aacrjournals.org/content/54/2/374.article-info|website=Journal of Cancer Research}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Journal of Investigative Dermatology Study|url=http://www.jidonline.org/action/doSearch?searchType=quick&searchText=harth&occurrences=all&journalCode=jid&searchScope=fullSite|website=Journal of Investigative Dermatology}}</ref>
He co-founded the [[Phototherapy]] Unit, Rambam Medical center, and was Director of the [[Photodynamic Therapy]] Unit, Elisha Medical Center in Haifa.<ref name="Bloomberg"/> Harth served on the faculty of [[American Academy of Dermatology]] (AAD) as part of the [[Photobiology]] training team<ref name="Endymed">[http://www.endymed.com/66098.html Autobiography in Endymed company site] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150910000825/http://www.endymed.com/66098.html |date=September 10, 2015 }}</ref> <ref name="Bloomberg"/> and the American Society for Laser Medicine and Surgery (ASLMS). <ref> [http://www.aslms.org/annualconference/110735_ASLMS_FinalProgram_opt.pdf American Society for Laser Medicine and Surgery] </ref>
Harth holds several [[patent]]s and has authored a number of papers and book chapters. <ref>[https://scholar.google.co.il/scholar?hl=en&q=%22Yoram+Harth%22&btnG= List of Publications in Google Scholar]{{dead link|date=July 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Scientific and business activity== Starting in 1998 Harth co-founded Curelight, an Israeli company, and developed Clearlight, an [[Acne vulgaris|acne]] [[phototherapy]] therapy system.<ref name="Singapore Medical"/><ref name="Amy Tiebel"/><ref name="Williams Samten"/>
Curelight was chosen by the [[Venture capital in Israel|Israeli Venture Capital]] Association as Best [[Startup company]] of 2002 ([[Medical Devices]]). Curelight was a finalist in the contest Entrepreneur of the year 2003, (Ernst & Young, Israel).
Harth was also a pioneer in the development of other novel devices for dermatological treatment among them the patented invention in the field of targeted multi–wavelength phototherapy for [[psoriasis]] and [[Vitiligo]].<ref name="Singapore Medical"/><ref name="Amy Tiebel"/>
In 2007 Harth co-founded Endymed Medical and Israeli company specializing in multisource [[radiofrequency]] devices for the professional and home use markets. Harth and his co-founder developed the first ever radiofrequency technology that uses 6 phase controlled generators.<ref>Novel Multi-Source Phase-Controlled Radiofrequency Technology for Nonablative and Micro-Ablative Treatment of Wrinkles, Lax Skin and Acne Scars ''Laser Therapy''. 2011, Vol. 20, NO. 2, p.139-144.</ref><ref name="Sean McKinney">McKinney, Sean. [http://digital.miinews.com/article/Multi-Source_RF_Signifies_New_Era_in_Anti-Wrinkle_and_Skin_Tightening_Technology/274824/27643/article.html "Multi-Source RF Signifies New Era in Anti-Wrinkle and Skin Tightening Technology"]. ''The Aesthetic Guide'' (November–December 2009).</ref> This technology allows multiple aesthetic treatments including painless skin tightening and lifting for the face and body. Fraction of a [[RF]] skin resurfacing for skin rejuvenation, acne scars and stretch and more. Endymed’s home use device was the world’s first energy based RF device to be approved by the FDA for home use facial wrinkle reduction.<ref name="Kobi Yeshayahou">Yeshayahou, Kobi (22 August 2013). [http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-1000874476 "EndyMed soars on FDA approval"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150925075119/http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-1000874476 |date=September 25, 2015 }}. [[Globes]].</ref><ref name="Ilya Petrou">Petrou, Ilya (September 2010). "[http://connection.ebscohost.com/c/articles/53452074/rf-innovation RF Innovation]". Cosmetic Surgery Times. Vol. 14. No. 8. Pp 1, 4, 6-7. (via EbscoHost)</ref>
This device was a winner of the [[Edison Awards|Edison Product innovation award]] for 2013. In 2017 Harth co-founded with Oded Harth, MDacne, a company that uses computer vision and deep learning technologies to help people with [[acne]]. MDacne mobile app analyzes the user skin and provides FDA cleared anti-acne topical customized medications that are personalized to the user’s skin type and acne condition. <ref name="San Francisco Chronicle"/> <ref name="Shacklett"/> <ref> [https://dailymed.nlm.nih.gov/dailymed/fda/fdaDrugXsl.cfm?setid=07cb4ee6-b9ac-43d0-aa1a-10ca26502046&type=display MD ACNE CUSTOMIZED TREATMENT- salicylic acid cream] </ref> The company is based in San Francisco and is backed by [[Khosla Ventures]], [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]] and SV Angel. <ref> (January 10, 2018).
